subject.normal: [jadmin] RE: Failed to connect to yahoo using Yahoo Transport

headers.subject: [jadmin] RE: Failed to connect to yahoo using Yahoo Transport

body.para: never hurts to send along your jabber.xml file :)
body.footer: -- Peter Saint-Andre email/jabber: stpeter@jabber.org blog: http://stpeter.manilasites.com/
body.para: On Tue, 16 Oct 2001, Kausik Saha wrote:

quote.quotepara: Yes, the yahoo transport have been installed. At startup the following message is displayed
Should I send the jabber.xml file?

Date: Mon, 15 Oct 2001 11:33:23 -0500 (CDT) From: Peter Saint-Andre <stpeter@jabber.org> To: jadmin@jabber.org Subject: Re: [jadmin] Failed to connect to yahoo using Yahoo Transport Reply-To: jadmin@jabber.org
stupid question here ... do you have the yahoo transport installed and running? it's not part of the base server install...
quote.quotefooter: -- Peter Saint-Andre email/jabber: stpeter@jabber.org blog: http://stpeter.manilasites.com/
quote.quotepara: On Mon, 15 Oct 2001, Kausik Saha wrote:
I am a newbie as far as Jabber is concerned and would appreciate a little help.

I have set up Jabber server 1.4.1 on a host and it runs fine as far as local communication (read intranet) is concerned. I have installed the Yahoo transport on the same host. However, when I click on 'Yahoo!" in Gateways to activate my Yahoo account, it gives the following message:
Jabber Instant Messanger was not able to contact a service or agent. It is possible that the error or service is not currently running. (Error code 502)
After that, the login screen (to Yahoo) is coming with only the Password field (instead of the fields User Id and Password)
The host on which the Jabber server is installed has a public IP.
What is it that I am doing wrong?
